title: Safari Seals NEW (FEEDBACK FROM BUYERS GIVEN )

posts.content:
new thread from original link
http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/viewtopic. ... 7&start=75

I know how everyone with safaris complains about leaking seals , so ive given 5 people the chance to try this seal out ive got , ive fitted it to 3 other vehicles myself with very good results ..... £35 a pair and postage is £3.50 although i will be at volksworld show with 2 of the vehicles that have them fitted ........
No w i cannot garauntee these wont leak as i dont know how or who fitted your windows , so im offering a returns option , you buy them if they arent any good to you send them back and a refund will be given , providing they arent damaged and i can resell them ..... I will refund item cost but not the postage costs ....... Cant be fairer than that .....
People that bought the first 5 sets are ......

1) Chaser`s down for a pair ............
2) lambretta ................
3)kilgore ...........
4)wilgartw ............
5) utting30..............

So if the feedback is encouraging , i will buy in more of it , if not then i will look for other alternatives ....
Thats really good service mate, nice one.

Well theres too many people buying stuff that dosent meet the grade ... If people are happy with these then great ...... customer is right kind of thing .... If it dosent do the job then why should you have to put up with it , thats my thinking .....

have you got a pic of the profile
whats differant to make it work better
or is it the materials used ?
Can you re-post up the photo of the profile, so I can check it against what I've got already. If its different, then I'll have a set to test.....
This is the profile ... Will try and get some shots of them fitted into the window area ...
Cool. Will check that against the seals I've got.

Thanks for these butty works well looks much better than my old rubber so much neater

Gaz

if any one wants a pic of it in place I can take one tomorrow and post it up!!

Hi Butty
have pm"d you about the last seal test you wanted, I have a origanal safari windows in my 23 window but the seals leak like f--k.
no probs if the last place is taken
but be cool if not

Fitted the seals today (thanks butty) and can comment on the fit and the look of the new seals but not their water resistance ....yet! As they haven`t been out in the rain.

OLD seals (Izz`s that came with windows)




If you look carefully you can see daylight in the corners.


NEW seals ala butty





As you can see, no daylight and to me a better look cosmetically.

The only comment I can make at the moment in order to make an improvement to the seals would be to join the ends together somehow. They would then be a rockin`set of rubbers, subject to water test.

I did as an afterthought apply some silicon (black instant gasket) between the outer lip and the window aperture to stop water getting under the seal and rotting out the panel or creeping over the flange and getting inside.

Glad you got them ok , do look better , as to the end connector i hadnt given that much thought but will have a think , company i buy it from may well do a joiner .....The sealer in the seal part that clips onto the body i think is the best idea (also felt you neeed to make sure sealer goes in deep not just a light smearing on the outer edge of the lip , will post pictures of what i mean ), as i feel most water gets in there and also the seal that the glass itself sits in ....

Im sure I already have a roll of that profile I will have to check fit on my bus.

Hopefully this will be the right one Si.
Thanks Butty Seals recieved this morning! Will have ago at fitting later this week and post up some water test pics
Still got some more of this stuff if needed ......

I brought some butty rubbers and can say there the best ive found! fit very nice twice as thick as creative ones and as for joining them i used alittle super glue and i used old seals for rear pop outs so no waste to , so well worth the buy i say
